books.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian

chapters.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:1
verses.text: Revelation of John: Revelation of Saint John the Theologian.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:2
verses.text: After the taking up of our Lord Jesus Christ, I John was alone upon Mount Tabor, where also He showed us His undefiled Godhead; and as I was not able to stand, I fell upon the ground, and prayed to the Lord, and said:  O Lord my God, who hast deemed me worthy to be Thy servant, hear my voice, and teach me about Thy coming.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:3
verses.text: When Thou shalt come to the earth, what will happen?  The heaven and the earth, and the sun and the moon, what will happen to them in those times?  Reveal to me all; for I am emboldened, because Thou listenest to Thy servant.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:4
verses.text: And I spent seven days praying; and after this a cloud of light caught me up from the mountain, and set me before the face of the heaven.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:5
verses.text: And I heard a voice saying to me:  Look up, John, servant of God, and know.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:6
verses.text: And having looked up, I saw the heaven opened, and there came forth from within the heaven a smell of perfumes of much sweet odour; and I saw an exceeding great flood of light, more resplendent than the sun.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:7
verses.text: And again I heard a voice saying to me:  Behold, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:8
verses.text: And I directed my sight, and saw a book lying, of the thickness, methought, of seven mountains; and the length of it the mind of man cannot comprehend, having seven seals.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:9
verses.text: And I said:  O Lord my God, reveal to me what is written in this book.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:10
verses.text: And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:11
verses.text: In this book which thou seest there have been written the things in the heaven, and the things in the earth, and the things in the abyss, and the judgments and righteousness of all the human race.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:12
verses.text: And I said:  Lord, when shall these things come to pass? and what do those times bring?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:13
verses.text: There shall be in that time abundance of corn and wine, such as there hath never been upon the earth, nor shall ever be until those times come.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:14
verses.text: Then the ear of corn shall produce a half choenix, and the bend of the branch shall produce a thousand clusters, and the cluster shall produce a half jar of wine; and in the following year there shall not be found upon the face of all the earth a half choenix of corn or a half jar of wine.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:15
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, thereafter what wilt Thou do?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:16
verses.text: Then shall appear the denier, and he who is set apart in the darkness, who is called Antichrist.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:17
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, reveal to me what he is like.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:18
verses.text: And I heard a voice saying to me:  The appearance of his face is dusky; the hairs of his head are sharp, like darts; his eyebrows like a wild beast's; his right eye like the star which rises in the morning, and the other like a lion's; his mouth about one cubit; his teeth span long; his fingers like scythes; the print of his feet of two spans; and on his face an inscription, Antichrist; he shall be exalted even to heaven, and shall be cast down even to Hades, making false displays.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:19
verses.text: And then will I make the heaven brazen, so that it shall not give moisture upon the earth; and I will hide the clouds in secret places, so that they shall not bring moisture upon the earth; and I will command the horns of the wind, so that the wind shall not blow upon the earth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:20
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and how many years will he do this upon the earth?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:21
verses.text: Three years shall those times be; and I will make the three years like three months, and the three months like three weeks, and the three weeks like three days, and the three days like three hours, and the three hours like three seconds, as said the prophet David, His throne hast Thou broken down to the ground; Thou hast shortened the days of his time; Thou hast poured shame upon him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:22
verses.text: And then I shall send forth Enoch and Elias to convict him; and they shall show him to be a liar and a deceiver; and he shall kill them at the altar, as said the prophet, Then shall they offer calves upon Thine altar.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:23
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and after that what will come to pass?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:24
verses.text: Then all the human race shall die, and there shall not be a living man upon all the earth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:25
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, after that what wilt Thou do?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:26
verses.text: Then will I send forth mine angels, and they shall take the ram's horns that lie upon the cloud; and Michael and Gabriel shall go forth out of the heaven and sound with those horns, as the prophet David foretold, With the voice of a trumpet of horn.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:27
verses.text: And the voice of the trumpet shall be heard from the one quarter of the world to the other; and from the voice of that trumpet all the earth shall be shaken, as the prophet foretold, And at the voice of the bird every plant shall arise; that is, at the voice of the archangel all the human race shall arise.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:28
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, those who are dead from Adam even to this day, and who dwell in Hades from the beginning of the world, and who die at the last ages, what like shall they arise?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:29
verses.text: All the human race shall arise thirty years old.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:30
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, they die male and female, and some old, and some young, and some infants.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:31
verses.text: In the resurrection what like shall they arise?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:32
verses.text: Just as the bees are, and differ not one from another, but are all of one appearance and one size, so also shall every man be in the resurrection.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:33
verses.text: There is neither fair, nor ruddy, nor black, neither Ethiopian nor different countenances; but they shall all arise of one appearance and one stature.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:34
verses.text: All the human race shall arise without bodies, as I told you that in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:35
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, is it possible in that world to recognise each other, a brother his brother, or a friend his friend, or a father his own children, or the children their own parents?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:36
verses.text: To the righteous there is recognition, but to the sinners not at all; they cannot in the resurrection recognise each other.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:37
verses.text: And again I John said:  Lord, is there there recollection of the things that are here, either fields or vineyards, or other things here?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:38
verses.text: The prophet David speaks, saying, I remembered that we are dust:  as for man, his days are as grass; as a flower of the field, so he shall flourish:  for a wind hath passed over it, and it shall be no more, and it shall not any longer know its place.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:39
verses.text: And again the same said:  His spirit shall go forth, and he returns to his earth; in that day all his thoughts shall perish.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:40
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and after that what wilt Thou do?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:41
verses.text: Then will I send forth mine angels over the face of all the earth, and they shall lift off the earth everything honourable, and everything precious, and the venerable and holy images, and the glorious and precious crosses, and the sacred vessels of the churches, and the divine and sacred books; and all the precious and holy things shall be lifted up by clouds into the air.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:42
verses.text: And then will I order to be lifted up the great and venerable sceptre, on which I stretched forth my hands, and all the orders of my angels shall do reverence to it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:43
verses.text: And then shall be lifted up all the race of men upon clouds, as the Apostle Paul foretold.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:44
verses.text: Along with them we shall be snatched up in clouds to meet the Lord in the air.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:45
verses.text: And then shall come forth every evil spirit, both in the earth and in the abyss, wherever they are on the face of all the earth, from the rising of the sun even to the setting, and they shall be united to him that is served by the devil, that is, Antichrist, and they shall be lifted up upon the clouds.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:46
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and after that what wilt Thou do?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:47
verses.text: Then shall I send forth mine angels over the face of all the earth, and they shall burn up the earth eight thousand five hundred cubits, and the great mountains shall be burnt up, and all the rocks shall be melted and shall become as dust, and every tree shall be burnt up, and every beast, and every creeping thing creeping upon the earth, and every thing moving upon the face of the earth, and every flying thing flying in the air; and there shall no longer be upon the face of all the earth anything moving, and the earth shall be without motion.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:48
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and after that what wilt Thou do?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:49
verses.text: Then shall I uncover the four parts of the east, and there shall come forth four great winds, and they shall sweep all the face of the earth from the one end of the earth to the other; and the Lord shall sweep sin from off the earth, and the earth shall be made white like snow, and it shall become as a leaf of paper, without cave, or mountain, or hill, or rock; but the face of the earth from the rising even to the setting of the sun shall be like a table, and white as snow; and the reins of the earth shall be consumed by fire, and it shall cry unto me, saying, I am a virgin before thee, O Lord, and there is no sin in me; as the prophet David said aforetime, Thou shalt sprinkle me with hyssop, and I shall be made pure; Thou shalt wash me, and I shall be made whiter than snow.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:50
verses.text: And again he said:  Every chasm shall be filled up, and every mountain and hill brought low, and the crooked places shall be made straight, and the rough ways into smooth; and all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:51
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and after that what wilt Thou do?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:52
verses.text: Then shall the earth be cleansed from sin, and all the earth shall be filled with a sweet smell, because I am about to come down upon the earth; and then shall come forth the great and venerable sceptre, with thousands of angels worshipping it, as I said before; and then shall appear the sign of the Son of man from the heaven with power and great glory.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:53
verses.text: And then the worker of iniquity with his servants shall behold it, and gnash his teeth exceedingly, and all the unclean spirits shall be turned to flight.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:54
verses.text: And then, seized by invisible power, having no means of flight, they shall gnash their teeth against him, saying to him:  Where is thy power?  How hast thou led us astray? and we have fled away, and have fallen away from the glory which we had beside Him who is coming to judge us, and the whole human race.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:55
verses.text: Woe to us! because He banishes us into outer darkness.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:56
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and after that what wilt Thou do?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Then will I send an angel out of heaven, and he shall cry with a loud voice, saying, Hear, O earth, and be strong, saith the Lord; for I am coming down to thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:57
verses.text: And the voice of the angel shall be heard from the one end of the world even to the other, and even to the remotest part of the abyss.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:58
verses.text: And then shall be shaken all the power of the angels and of the many-eyed ones, and there shall be a great noise in the heavens, and the nine regions of the heaven shall be shaken, and there shall be fear and astonishment upon all the angels.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:59
verses.text: And then the heavens shall be rent from the rising of the sun even to the setting, and an innumerable multitude of angels shall come down to the earth; and then the treasures of the heavens shall be opened, and they shall bring down every precious thing, and the perfume of incense, and they shall bring down to the earth Jerusalem robed like a bride.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:60
verses.text: And then there shall go before me myriads of angels and archangels, bearing my throne, crying out, Holy, holy, holy, Lord of Sabaoth; heaven and earth are full of Thy glory.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:61
verses.text: And then will I come forth with power and great glory, and every eye in the clouds shall see me; and then every knee shall bend, of things in heaven, and things on earth, and things under the earth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:62
verses.text: And then the heaven shall remain empty; and I will come down upon the earth, and all that is in the air shall be brought down upon the earth, and all the human race and every evil spirit along with Antichrist, and they shall all be set before me naked, and chained by the neck.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:63
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, what will become of the heavens, and the sun, and the moon, along with the stars?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Behold, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:64
verses.text: And I looked, and saw a Lamb having seven eyes and seven horns.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:65
verses.text: And again I heard a voice saying to me:  I will bid the Lamb come before me, and will say, Who will open this book?  And all the multitudes of the angels will answer, Give this book to the Lamb to open it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:66
verses.text: And then will I order the book to be opened.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:67
verses.text: And when He shall open the first seal, the stars of the heaven shall fall, from the one end of it to the other.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:68
verses.text: And when He shall open the second seal, the moon shall be hidden, and there shall be no light in her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:69
verses.text: And when He shall open the third seal, the light of the sun shall be withheld, and there shall not be light upon the earth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:70
verses.text: And when He shall open the fourth seal, the heavens shall be dissolved, and the air shall be thrown into utter confusion, as saith the prophet:  And the heavens are the works of Thy hands; they shall perish, but Thou endurest, and they shall all wax old as a garment.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:71
verses.text: And when He shall open the fifth seal, the earth shall be rent, and all the tribunals upon the face of all the earth shall be revealed.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:72
verses.text: And when He shall open the sixth seal, the half of the sea shall disappear.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:73
verses.text: And when He shall open the seventh seal, Hades shall be uncovered.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:74
verses.text: And I said:  Lord, who will be the first to be questioned, and to receive judgment?  And I heard a voice saying to me, The unclean spirits, along with the adversary.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:75
verses.text: I bid them go into outer darkness, where the depths are.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:76
verses.text: And I said:  Lord, and in what place does it lie?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:77
verses.text: As big a stone as a man of thirty years old can roll, and let go down into the depth, even falling down for twenty years will not arrive at the bottom of Hades; as the prophet David said before, And He made darkness His secret place.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:78
verses.text: And I said:  Lord, and after them what nation will be questioned?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:79
verses.text: There will be questioned of Adam's race those nations, both the Greek and those who have believed in idols, and in the sun, and in the stars, and those who have defiled the faith by heresy, and who have not believed the holy resurrection, and who have not confessed the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost:  then will I send them away into Hades, as the prophet David foretold, Let the sinners be turned into Hades, and all the nations that forget God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:80
verses.text: And again he said:  They were put in Hades like sheep; death shall be their shepherd.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:81
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and after them whom wilt Thou judge?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:82
verses.text: Then the race of the Hebrews shall be examined, who nailed me to the tree like a malefactor.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:83
verses.text: And I said:  And what punishment will these get, and in what place, seeing that they did such things to Thee?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  They shall go away into Tartarus, as the prophet David foretold, They cried out, and there was none to save; to the Lord, and He did not hearken to them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:84
verses.text: And again the Apostle Paul said:  As many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law, and as many as have sinned in law shall be judged by means of law.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:85
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and what of those who have received baptism?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Then the race of the Christians shall be examined, who have received baptism; and then the righteous shall come at my command, and the angels shall go and collect them from among the sinners, as the prophet David foretold:  The Lord will not suffer the rod of the sinners in the lot of the righteous; and all the righteous shall be placed on my right hand, and shall shine like the sun.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:86
verses.text: As thou seest, John, the stars of heaven, that they were all made together, but differ in light, so shall it be with the righteous and the sinners; for the righteous shall shine as lights and as the sun, but the sinners shall stand in darkness.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:87
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and do all the Christians go into one punishment?—kings, high priests, priests, patriarchs, rich and poor, bond and free?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:88
verses.text: As the prophet David foretold, The expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:89
verses.text: Now about kings:  they shall be driven like slaves, and shall weep like infants; and about patriarchs, and priests, and Levites, of those that have sinned, they shall be separated in their punishments, according to the nature of the peculiar transgression of each,—some in the river of fire, and some to the worm that dieth not, and others in the seven-mouthed pit of punishment.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:90
verses.text: To these punishments the sinners will be apportioned.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:91
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and where will the righteous dwell?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  Then shall paradise be revealed; and the whole world and paradise shall be made one, and the righteous shall be on the face of all the earth with my angels, as the Holy Spirit foretold through the prophet David:  The righteous shall inherit the earth, and dwell therein for ever and ever.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:92
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, how great is the multitude of the angels? and which is the greater, that of angels or of men?  And I heard a voice saying to me:  As great as is the multitude of the angels, so great is the race of men, as the prophet has said, He set bounds to the nations according to the number of the angels of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:93
verses.text: And again I said:  Lord, and after that what wilt Thou do? and what is to become of the world?  Reveal to me all.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:94
verses.text: And I heard a voice saying to me:  Hear, righteous John.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:95
verses.text: After that there is no pain, there is no grief, there is no groaning; there is no recollection of evils, there are no tears, there is no envy, there is no hatred of brethren, there is no unrighteousness, there is no arrogance, there is no slander, there is no bitterness, there are none of the cares of life, there is no pain from parents or children, there is no pain from gold, there are no wicked thoughts, there is no devil, there is no death, there is no night, but all is day.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:96
verses.text: As I said before, And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold, that is, men who have been made like the angels through their excellent course of life; them also must I bring, and they will hear my voice, and there shall be one fold, one shepherd.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:97
verses.text: And again I heard a voice saying to me:  Behold, thou hast heard all these things, righteous John; deliver them to faithful men, that they also may teach others, and not think lightly of them, nor cast our pearls before swine, lest perchance they should trample them with their feet.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:98
verses.text: And while I was still hearing this voice, the cloud brought me down, and put me on Mount Thabor.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:99
verses.text: And there came a voice to me, saying:  Blessed are those who keep judgment and do righteousness in all time.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Revelation of John the Theologian 1:100
verses.text: And blessed is the house where this description lies, as the Lord said, He that loveth me keepeth my sayings in Christ Jesus our Lord; to Him be glory for ever,  Amen.
